docs.snippet: Mike Isaac, a reporter for The New York Times, connects Facebook’s gamble on augmented reality apps with a murder posted on the social network.
The potential perils that come with broad access to consumers have led companies to take it very seriously.

headline.print_headline: United Affair Forces Brands to Take Social Media Seriously
headline.main: United and Pepsi Affairs Force Brands to Respect Social Media

docs.snippet: The new F.C.C. chairman’s plan to slacken net neutrality rules is a boon to tech giants and a bane to competitors and innovators.

headline.main: Giving the Behemoths a Leg Up on the Little Guy

docs.snippet: The Big Five tech companies increasingly dominate our lives. Could you ditch them?

headline.main: Which Tech Giant Would You Drop?

docs.snippet: Some mutual funds already have stakes as companies go public. This can be a high-risk and high-reward proposition.

headline.print_headline: Snapping Up Snap? Funds Beat You to It
headline.main: Mutual Funds Buy Hot Stocks Like Snap Ahead of I.P.O.s
